data.title: ($1,604) Movers From Virginia to Phoenix
data.meta_description: Moving from Virginia to Phoenix, AZ? Find the best movers, cost, and everything you should know about moving from Virginia to Phoenix.
data.text:
Quick answer: The cost to move from Virginia to Phoenix, AZ averages from $1,744 to $9,367 depending on how much you’re moving, your move date, and whether you hire a company or do the move yourself.

Moving the reverse route? We’ve got you covered with our moving from Phoenix, AZ to Virginia guide.

Why trust moveBuddha?

Since 2015, we’ve used our inside knowledge of the moving industry to help more than 400,000 people with their moves.

We go beyond the standard online review to dig deep into our readers’ personal moving experiences through our Better Moves Project. We’ve also developed our own rating system to evaluate each moving company based on their services, reputation, customer satisfaction, and other key factors.

Our content is thoroughly fact-checked and reviewed by our team of in-house experts to ensure the information you get is relevant, accurate, and up-to-date.

Moving from Virginia to Phoenix, AZ resources

In this article, we’ll lay out everything you need to know for your upcoming move from Virginia to Phoenix, AZ.

But first, here are a few resources if you need immediate answers:

Best Virginia to Phoenix, AZ movers: If you plan on hiring a moving company be sure to check out our list of the top movers from Virginia to Phoenix, AZ.

How much will your move cost?: Want to narrow down how much your move will cost? Use our moving cost calculator to get more specific price ranges and recommendations on the best companies to use for your move.

Consider moving containers: Need a more budget-friendly option? With these companies, you load and they drive! These are the best moving container companies.

Virginia to Phoenix, AZ car shippers: Moving your car? Use an experienced company that prioritizes professionalism and cares for your vehicle.

Moving 2,156 miles is no joke. Here's what you need to know.

Hiring an interstate moving company from Virginia to Phoenix is a big deal.

There are more than 8,000 moving companies in the U.S. But don’t worry, you won’t have to filter through all of them. We’ve done the research for you and narrowed the list based on customer satisfaction, cost, and services.

Here are the best long-distance moving companies serving Virginia to Phoenix.

What is the average cost to move from Virginia to Phoenix, AZ?

The table below lays out average cost ranges to move from Virginia to Phoenix for different moving services depending on the size of your home.

Size of the Move Moving Company Moving Container Rental Truck Studio / 1 Bedroom $1,604 - $5,809 $1,626 - $3,799 $1,642 - $3,202 2 - 3 bedrooms $4,367 - $9,367 $2,809 - $5,744 $1,744 - $3,594 4+ bedrooms $8,194 - $14,415 $3,779 - $7,614 $2,201 - $4,448

*These price ranges are a rough estimate based on 2,156 miles and historical averages. The actual size of your move, additional services required, truck parking access, market conditions, and availability can greatly affect the final cost of your move.

The cost to move from Virginia to Phoenix, AZ will depend on:

Move size: The amount of items you have — as well as your home size and layout — will impact the total cost of your relocation.

Time of year: Summer is peak moving season in Virginia, so moving companies will likely charge more.

DIY vs. professional mover: DIY moving services are usually cheaper but involve more work and stress compared to letting the pros handle your move.

How much does it cost to hire professional movers from Virginia to Phoenix?

Hiring movers for a studio apartment or one-bedroom home from Virginia to Phoenix will cost between $1,604 to $5,809. The cost to move a two- to three-bedroom home from Virginia to Phoenix will range from $4,367 to $9,367, and a large move from Virginia to Phoenix will cost from $8,194 to $14,415.

How much are moving containers like PODS from Virginia to Phoenix?

Moving containers from Virginia to Phoenix will cost you $1,626 to $3,799 for a small move. For a two- to three-bedroom move, moving containers can cost $2,809 to $5,744. A four-bedroom move or bigger will cost $3,779 to $7,614.

Here are the cheapest moving containers for your move to Phoenix.

How much is a moving truck from Virginia to Phoenix?

A moving rental truck is generally the cheapest option for moving from Virginia to Phoenix, but it requires you to do all of the driving and labor.

Moving a studio or one-bedroom apartment in a rental truck will cost around $1,642 to $3,202. A larger move will cost $1,744 to $3,594, and a four-bedroom or more move from Virginia to Phoenix costs from $2,201 to $4,448. These estimates include the estimated fuel cost.

Here are the cheapest rental truck companies for your move from Virginia.

Is moving from Virginia to Phoenix, AZ a good idea?

Cost of living: Virginia vs Phoenix, AZ

Virginia Phoenix Average rent cost $1,257 $1,795 Average home value $372,801 $417,105 Average income (per capita) $87,249 $63,135 Unemployment rate 3% 7% State income tax 6% 3%

Rent is about 43% more expensive in Phoenix than in Virginia.

Home prices are about 12% higher in Phoenix than in Virginia.

The average income is about 28% lower in Phoenix than in Virginia.

Phoenix has a higher unemployment rate than Virginia by about 100%.

Income taxes are 57% lower in Phoenix than in Virginia.

How is life different in Phoenix from Virginia?

Phoenix Virginia Population 1,608,139 8,683,619 Political leaning Democrat 50-48 Democratic 54-44 Summer high 105ºF 87ºF Winter low 43ºF 25ºF Annual rain 9" 44" Annual snow 0" 14" Crime index 42.86 17.05

The population of Phoenix is approximately 81% lower than the population of Virginia.

In the last presidential election, Phoenix voted Democrat and Virginia voted Democratic.

The average high in the summertime in Phoenix is 105ºF and in Virginia, it’s 87ºF.

During the coldest part of the year, Phoenix reaches the temperature of 43ºF and Virginia gets down to 25ºF.

You can expect about 9 inches of annual rainfall in Phoenix vs 44 inches of rainfall in Virginia.

In Phoenix, it snows about 0 inches annually vs 14 inches of snow in Virginia.

Phoenix has a higher crime rate than Virginia with a crime index of 42.86 vs 17.05.

Considerations for moving to Phoenix, AZ

Weather: The climate is unlikely to affect your move but summers in Phoenix are unsurprisingly very hot with daily averages over 100° F. You should take this into consideration because moving often requires spending many hours outdoors. You should also be sure that air conditioning is set up in your new home before move day, especially if you're moving in the summer.

HOA rules: Check ahead with any neighborhood or community rules on moving to ensure a smooth move.

Elevator reservation: One common and important example of something that should be handled ahead of time is reserving the building's elevator and finding out their rules for using the elevator.

Parking permits: Some cities require parking permits for large vehicles, find out ahead of time with your new local rules.

State licensing: Though Arizona is largely an “unregulated” state, local moving companies are subject to some Arizona Department of Public Safety (AZDPS) and Department of Weights and Measures regulations intended to ensure that they operate safely and ethically. Make sure the moving company you use has a license before hiring.

State regulator: You can verify a Arizona moving license and its status on the state regulator's official website.

Moving permits: Arizona does not require any moving permits, but it is helpful to check local parking restrictions before moving into the state.

Change of address: We recommend submitting your change of address form with USPS at least a week prior to your move. You can set an official move date on the form and this way all of your mail will get properly forwarded to Arizona. Get started here.

Mover's insurance: Every state has their own requirements when it comes to insurance. Choose Released Value Protection for its cost-effectiveness—offered by movers at no extra charge, although it provides minimal coverage. With a liability limit of 60 cents per pound per article, consider this option carefully. For instance, if a 50-inch TV weighing 25 pounds is lost or damaged, your reimbursement would only be $15 (60 cents x 25 pounds). For comprehensive coverage of your items' full value, consult with your moving company for alternative options or consider third-party insurance providers.

Moving checklist: Peace of mind is priceless. Our moving checklist will help you know you’ve got everything covered.

There are always a lot of reasons to get excited about living somewhere new. These are the best parts of living in Virginia vs Phoenix side-by-side.

Not everything is sunshine and rainbows, these are the things to be aware of when leaving Virginia for Phoenix.

FAQs

How far in advance should I book movers when moving from Virginia to Phoenix?

Because of the 2156-mile move, it’s best to book your move from Virginia to Phoenix as soon as you have your moving details. Ideally, you’d book your move two to three months ahead of time.

What time of year is the cheapest to move to Phoenix, AZ?

With the summer highs of 105ºF and the winter lows of 43ºF, most people move to Phoenix from Virginia during the spring and fall months. To avoid competing during those busy seasons, you could save some money by booking your move to Phoenix during summer or winter.

Where can I find a list of long-distance moving companies from Phoenix?

Check out our full breakdown of the best long-distance movers in Phoenix.
